This 10% absenteeism doesn’t include anyone that may be absent for other reasons.”

We all need to be realistic, but we also need to trust the process and procedures that we have developed with the Henry County Public Health Department to handle each case. I don’t mention this to cause anxiety, but I want everyone to be prepared for what will be ahead of us. Listed below are several items that are important for our return.

June 2, 2020
Attention New London Junior and Senior Students and Parents/Guardians:

At this time, we regret to inform you that the 2020 New London Junior-Senior Prom has been canceled. During this entire process we have explored many different avenues that would allow us to host prom for our students in an environment that was fun, memorable, and safe. As we continued to explore various options and asked for guidance it became apparent that it was almost impossible to follow social distancing guidelines in all prom activities.

This was a difficult decision and one that we did not come to lightly. Our hope was that by waiting, seeking out guidance, and finding alternatives that we could in the end have prom for our students. In the end, the safety of our students and staff is our number one priority.

If you have any questions, please contact Superintendent Chad Wahls at 319-367-0512 or chad.wahls@nlcsd.org.

Sincerely,
Chad Wahls, Scott Kracht, and Todd Palmatier

New London Community School District
April 21 at 5:09 PM ·

With the recent news of school closure for the remainder of the year we are scheduling a time for all students to gather their personal belongings that they may have left prior to March 16th. This Thursday, April 23rd the Elementary and MS/HS buildings will be open for students and parents to collect personal belongings. Our doors will be open from 11:30 - 6:00 and we will monitor the number of people that will be allowed to enter each building at a time. We ask our track athletes to also return their uniforms to the office during this time as well. If you are unable to collect your belongings they will be taken to the Central Office Building until the end of the month. At that time any belongings that are not collected will be donated to GoodWill or thrown away. Middle School and High School students this means your activity lockers as well must be cleaned out or locks will be cut off and items will be removed. We will schedule a Senior checkout date towards the end of May, along with a computer turn in day for all remaining K-11 students.

ON TO STATE! Congratulations to the students on their performances at the District Large Group Speech Contest this past Saturday in Lone Tree. Their hard work and dedication earned them Division I ratings, advancing them to State Contest on Feb. 8th at Cedar Rapids Washington High School. The One-Act Play Asylum, the Short Film Through My Eyes, and the Group Improvisation "Carter-Little" will compete with the hopes of receiving not only another Division I rating, but also a nomination to the Large Group Speech All-State Festival.

One-Act Play Cast : Maclane White, Griffin Berndt, La'Nya Franklin, Joseph Hedgecock, Elijah Curry, Samuel Denney, Reed Kempker, Alec Smith, Victoria Zaragoza, Addison Brown, Rachel Carter, & Annie Sines(Crew/Spotlight)

Short Film Cast: Addison Brown (Co-writer/Student Director), Victoria Zaragoza (Co-writer/Student Director), Griffin Berndt, Ryan McLerran, & Joseph Hedgecock

Group Improvisation Cast: Rachel Carter & Gwendolynn Little
